labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.52

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

`https://kriptokoin.com/`

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Turkish filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots


The website has a new design so the rules below are now redundant.

```

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/32505
kriptokoin.com#@#.share-container
kriptokoin.com##.sidebar_inner > #text-75  


https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/39161

kriptokoin.com#?#.wpb_wrapper > div.widget_text:has(> strong:contains(/Reklam|BlockShow/)) 
/970x250-$image,domain=kriptokoin.com   
/Lunabit.gif$domain=kriptokoin.com 
kriptokoin.com#?#aside > div.sidebar_inner > div.widget_text:has(> strong:contains(Reklam)) 
/*-Banners$image,domain=kriptokoin.com  

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/78195
kriptokoin.com##.top-bar-ads  


https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/83086
kriptokoin.com#?#.wpb_wrapper > div.widget_text > div.textwidget > ins + script:upward(div.widget_text)  
kriptokoin.com##.widget_viewedimages ~ div.widget  
kriptokoin.com##a[href^="https://www.bitci.com/"]  
kriptokoin.com##.header-coins-container  
||kriptokoin.com/wp-content/uploads/*/728x100.jpg 
||wp.com/kriptokoin.com/wp-content/uploads/*/realbetis.jpg 


https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/9b849caddff116ae48f18bca9cdf80dc82d72c08
kriptokoin.com#?#div[class^="sidebar_inner"] > div.widget:has(> div.textwidget > p > a[target="_blank"])
```

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Установите AdGuard Extra, перед этим очистив данные браузера с последующим его перезапуском.

---

Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: Related to the "I don't care about cookies" filter

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

The "I don't care about cookies" filter description doesn't currently explain if enabling it would cause that the "cookies consent" would disapear, automatically agreeing or rejecting the cookies, including the so called "IAD" (or whatever shortcut is used for the "legitimate interest of the administrator").

In many countries, such "legitimate interest of the administrator" is a way to bypass the restrictions of the Data Protection Act and ilegally aquire and process user data

### Proposed solution

Fix the explanation and cause that the filter would automatically reject such agreement's and block such cookies

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: This filter is not enabled by default. User enables it if he want.

comment.body:
Unfortunately, the reported issue does not satisfy our [filters policy](https://kb.adguard.com/en/general/adguard-filter-policy). The website has low visitors. Rules for the user rules:
```
bandwagon.asia##.ads-embedsocial
bandwagon.asia##.newsletter__form--large
```

comment.body:
Hm, try to do next:
1. Leave only AdGuard Base
2. Update it
3. Clear browser data, then restart the browser
4. Reproduce the issue

If you still get this, please do:
1. Open the filtering log and keep it in the background
2. Reproduce the issue
3. Switch back to the filtering log
4. Press on `Blocked` button
5. Make a screenshot
6. Now press on `Modified` button
7. Make a screenshot
8. Send both of them here.

labels.name: A: In progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://cheaperthandirt.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcheaperthandirt.com) ### Comment Username: @JohnStephenSimonJr > When I receive emails from CheaperThanDirt.com and I click on links, with my AdGuard on, I get a message from Microsoft (Edge, Windows something) that says "Hmmm, Can't link that page." There is a reference to exponea.com. When I clink on links, with my AdGuard off, I go to the CheaperThanDirt page. > > If you look at the Email page I have my cursor on hover and you can see the link is directing me to exponea.com initially which is then, after logging me personally as responding to the email, is directing me to the CheaperThanDirt page. > > I looked up exponea.com and it appears to be a legitimate service that outsources management of web based marketing and loyalty programs for various businesses. I have the same issue with OluKai.com and Lenovo US where I am also a customer with some slight variations, same result - blocked email link. My semi-educated guess is that something in how exponea grabs my response to track me before sending me to their customer's website sets off AdGuard as I have it configured. I am guessing that exponea has their system set-up so that if the tracking info is blocked, they don't put the link request through, and the DNS error results. I would presume that I am not the first person to have this issue given exponea's market presence. > > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/dynmhnckwgoc0kgckkws0ksc80c8o8k8jnuypeeatc.png?nc=1)

issue.title: NotTheBee.com & BabylonBee.Com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

Latest nightly

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

Most; examples below

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Experimental filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Mask your IP address (specify in comment below, if used custom value)

### Add your comment and screenshots

As a followup to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/111351 & https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/48254, the sibling sites have the potential for a simple URL rewrite to reduce ads & then regular filtering improves.  Examples are 
- [ ] [https://notthebee.com/<kbd>**article**</kbd>/check-out-this-mini-oasis-that-this-dude-made-on-his-balcony-for-all-the-neighborhood-squirrels](https://notthebee.com/article/check-out-this-mini-oasis-that-this-dude-made-on-his-balcony-for-all-the-neighborhood-squirrels) → [https://notthebee.com/<kbd>**cleanArticle**</kbd>/check-out-this-mini-oasis-that-this-dude-made-on-his-balcony-for-all-the-neighborhood-squirrels](https://notthebee.com/cleanArticle/check-out-this-mini-oasis-that-this-dude-made-on-his-balcony-for-all-the-neighborhood-squirrels)

- [ ] [https://babylonbee.com/<kbd>**news**</kbd>/report-the-squirrels-are-up-to-something](https://babylonbee.com/news/report-the-squirrels-are-up-to-something) → [https://babylonbee.com/<kbd>**cleanArticle**</kbd>/report-the-squirrels-are-up-to-something](https://babylonbee.com/cleanArticle/report-the-squirrels-are-up-to-something)

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
